front.title: The Common Intrusion Detection Framework - Data Formats

abstract.t: This document defines portions of the Common Intrusion DetectionFramework (CIDF), specifically the data formats used. CIDF is designedto allow intrusion detection systems (IDS) to interoperate with oneanother. Two layered formats are defined here: Gidos, which are a high-level datastructure intended to allow IDS systems to exchange messages describingthe state of the world, events occurring, and recommended actions withsomewhat standardized semantics. Gidos can be encoded in CIDF messages,the format for which is also defined here.
